item.title: 15-17 high street (crampton road) health hazard HMO, 30th September
item.description:
As is reported on a weekly basis, the residents from this HMO are leaving a pile of filth (e.g. dirty nappies, raw meat) on the pavement outside this block of flats on an almost daily basis. Why nothing has been done is beyond me - other councils would not put up with this so why is this going unchecked? It is no good just clearing up after them, there needs to a fine or punishment for repeat offending.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Crampton Road, Penge, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Damaged and Unstable Fence, 30th September
item.description:
Damaged fence located between a property boundary and an open space, which has become a serious safety and security concern. The fence is currently broken and leaning heavily, appearing unstable and at risk of imminent collapse if not repaired promptly. This area is used regularly by local residents, including families with young children, and is also accessed by vehicles. The current condition of the fence poses a significant risk of injury and has contributed to an increased sense of vulnerability and reduced security for nearby properties. I believe the damage occurred during an attempted burglary on the 27th of September. Although the fence is not officially owned by any of the landlords, it serves as a physical divider between private property fence and public/open space and therefore plays a key role in maintaining both safety and privacy. Given the potential danger and the ongoing use of the area, I urge that immediate action be taken to assess and repair the fence.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Rider Close, Falconwood, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Sustainable planting beds need weeding, 30th September
item.description:
The sustainable plant beds in the High Street look in a sorry state full of weeds. Whilst we have been assured there will be some new plants added this Autumn, there is a distinct lack of care for them. I’m often pulling rubbish and weeds out. However now beds semi overgrown with weeds. Please can you do a tidy up? Thanks

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 53, High Street, Chislehurst, London
Report on FixMyStreet
